meta.title: Session 22: Excel Page Layout & Review
meta.description: Mastering Excel's printing controls via Page Layout (Scale to Fit, Print Area) and utilizing Review tools for proofing, commenting, and protecting data.

studyTopics.hint: Set Margins, Orientation, and Print Area before printing.
studyTopics.searchQuery: excel set print area and page orientation guide
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Configure page settings to ensure data prints correctly without cutting off columns.

studyTopics.hint: Shrinking data to fit on one page width.
studyTopics.searchQuery: how to use scale to fit in excel for printing
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Adjust the scale of the worksheet to fit specific paper dimensions (e.g., 1 page wide).

studyTopics.hint: Decide if gridlines and ABC/123 headings appear on print.
studyTopics.searchQuery: excel print gridlines and row column headings
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Control the visibility of gridlines and headings on both the screen and printed paper.

studyTopics.hint: Locking the sheet so others can't edit cells.
studyTopics.searchQuery: how to protect sheet and workbook in excel with password
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Secure data by restricting editing permissions using Protect Sheet and Protect Workbook.

studyTopics.hint: Check spelling and leave notes for teammates.
studyTopics.searchQuery: excel spell check and insert comments tutorial
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Ensure data accuracy with spell check and collaborate using comments.

studyTopics.searchQuery: using themes in excel to change colors and fonts
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Apply professional design themes to coordinate fonts and color schemes across the workbook.

questions.question: You have a spreadsheet that is just slightly too wide to fit on one printed page. Which 'Scale to Fit' setting would best solve this?
questions.explanation: Setting the Width to '1 page' in the Scale to Fit group forces Excel to shrink the content just enough to fit horizontally on a single page.

questions.question: Which feature allows you to define a specific range of cells that you want to print, ignoring the rest of the worksheet?
questions.explanation: The 'Print Area' command tells Excel to print only the selected range of cells.

questions.question: In the Sheet Options group, if you check the box for 'Print' under Gridlines, what happens?
options: The gridlines will appear on the printed paper
questions.explanation: By default, gridlines appear on screen but not on paper. Checking 'Print' makes them visible on the hard copy.

questions.question: What is the function of 'Protect Sheet' in the Review tab?
options: It protects the file from viruses
It prevents unwanted changes from others by locking cells
questions.explanation: Protect Sheet locks the cells so that other users cannot modify the data or formatting without a password (if set).

questions.question: Which tool would you use to find a synonym (a word with a similar meaning) for a selected word?
questions.explanation: The Thesaurus provides lists of synonyms and antonyms for the selected word.

questions.question: If you want to repeat the top row (header) of your table on every printed page, which Page Setup option should you use?
questions.explanation: Print Titles allows you to specify rows to repeat at the top of every printed page.

questions.question: What is the effect of applying a 'Theme' to your workbook?
options: It changes the set of colors, fonts, and effects used throughout the workbook
questions.explanation: Themes provide a unified look by applying consistent colors, fonts, and graphic effects.

questions.question: The 'Smart Lookup' feature in the Insights group uses the internet to:
options: Find definitions, images, and other information about the selected text
questions.explanation: Smart Lookup (powered by Bing) searches the web for contextually relevant information about your selected data.

questions.question: Which Page Orientation prints the page horizontally (wider)?
questions.explanation: Landscape orientation aligns the page horizontally, which is useful for wide spreadsheets.

questions.question: What does the 'Accessibility Checker' do?
options: Identifies issues that might make the file difficult for people with disabilities to read
questions.explanation: It scans the workbook for accessibility issues, such as missing alt text on images or hard-to-read color contrast.

questions.question: Which shortcut key is commonly used to run a Spell Check?
questions.explanation: F7 is the standard keyboard shortcut to launch the Spelling dialog box.

questions.question: Where can you add a background image that appears on the screen (but usually doesn't print)?
questions.explanation: The Background button in Page Layout adds a tiled image behind the cells for on-screen viewing.

questions.question: If you want to manually force a new page to start at a specific row when printing, what should you insert?
questions.explanation: Insert Page Break forces the printer to end the current page and start a new one at the selected location.

questions.question: The 'Translate' feature allows you to:
options: Convert selected text from one language to another
questions.explanation: Translate connects to online services to translate words or paragraphs into a different language.

questions.question: If you Protect a Workbook (Structure), what are users prevented from doing?
options: Adding, deleting, hiding, or renaming sheets
questions.explanation: Protecting the Workbook Structure specifically locks the arrangement of sheets (e.g., preventing users from adding or deleting tabs).

questions.question: To leave a note for a colleague about a specific cell value without changing the cell content, you should use:
questions.explanation: Comments and Notes allow you to attach feedback or explanations to a specific cell.

questions.question: In the Arrange group, 'Bring Forward' is used to:
options: Move data to the next sheet
Bring a selected object (like a shape) one step closer to the front of the stack
questions.explanation: Bring Forward changes the layering order of overlapping objects.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT an option in the 'Sheet Options' group?
questions.explanation: Spell Check is located in the Review tab, not in the Sheet Options group of Page Layout.

questions.question: Standard paper sizes available in the 'Size' dropdown include:
questions.explanation: A4, Letter, and Legal are standard industry paper sizes.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'Breaks' > 'Remove Page Break'?
options: To delete a manually inserted page break
questions.explanation: This command removes manual page breaks that were previously inserted.
